meta.description: A modern system language intended to replace C. No hidden control flow, no hidden memory allocations.

topics.title: Hello World
topics.desc: Zig uses the standard library for printing. Main returns void or an error.

topics.title: Variables
topics.desc: `const` is preferred. `var` is mutable. Types can often be inferred.

topics.title: Primitive Types
topics.desc: Explicit integers (u8, i32, usize) and floats.

topics.title: Control Flow
topics.desc: If expressions and switches. Switches must be exhaustive.

topics.title: Loops
topics.desc: For loops work on ranges, slices, and arrays.

topics.title: Functions
topics.desc: CamelCase naming. Parameters are immutable by default.

topics.title: Error Handling
topics.desc: Errors are values (Error Unions). No exceptions.

topics.title: Try Operator
topics.desc: `try` checks an error; if present, it returns it immediately.

topics.title: Optionals
topics.desc: Pointers cannot be null. Use `?T` for nullable types.

topics.title: Allocators
topics.desc: No hidden allocations. You must pass an allocator manually.

topics.title: Defer
topics.desc: Execute code on scope exit. Crucial for resource management.

topics.title: Comptime
topics.desc: Run code at compile time. Zig's alternative to Macros and Generics.

topics.title: Slices
topics.desc: A pointer + length. The core way to view memory.

topics.title: C Interop
topics.desc: Import C headers directly and link against C libraries.

topics.title: Build System
topics.desc: Zig build system is written in Zig (`build.zig`).
